title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.2 PREVENTION

description.narrative: Output 3.3. Children and their families are accessing quality multi-sectoral protection services including birth registration by 2025, which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2025, children in Uganda especially the most vulnerable and those affected by humanitarian situations are protected from all forms of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation, including harmful practices, and realize their right to legal identity

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3. Children and their families are accessing quality multi-sectoral protection services including birth registration by2025

description.narrative: Community groups and social networks including adolescents continued to benefit from skills development to identify risk and to prevent and respond to all forms of VAC. UNICEF engagement with multi-sectoral stakeholders led to national consensus on development of a comprehensive and inclusive parenting programme to prevent VAC and harmful practices, while a total of 22,695 parents and caregivers were reached through the positive parenting programme. The skills of 2,752 national and district government officers and partners on social and behavioural change communication were enhanced, enabling them to plan, implement and monitor integrated media campaigns on VAC prevention and harmful practices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2022
